chapter.para: This section needs further development. Suggestions are welcome.

section.title: Adding Applications

section.title: Build Instructions
section.para: When developing instructions to build a package, the editor should recommend a preferred build method—one that is reliable, stable, and performs well. The editor uses his best judgement to determine the appropriate switches and methodology for the typical user in each section. In some cases, the number of options is large and there should be a note placed in the text to tell the user to consult other documentaion for additional options.

section.title: Optimization
section.para: Generally custom optimization beyond the application's default optimization should not be encouraged. It generally causes more problems than it is worth. In some cases, certain optimizations may be recommended, but this should be done with appropriate warnings.

listitem.para: acronym -- a word formed from the initial letter or letters of each of the successive parts or major parts of a compound term.

filename -- a filename, a fully qualified file name, a directory (use class="directory"), a library file (use class="libraryfile"). Do not encapsulate an acronym tag with a filename tag, use either/or based on the usage.
Other extentions that may be used are extention, devicefile, headerfile, partition and symlink. These are not normally used, but could be used in the future in the rendering process.
envar -- an environmental variable, can be common or temporary.
command -- any string that will execute when entered at the prompt (not just bash prompts).

userinput -- usually encapsulates "command" when it is expected that the user is required to input the command to proceed. "command"s may terminate within userinput to continue showing items that must be typed in, but are not commands.
option -- Should be used when command options are written without the command, as use <option>-q</option> for quiet operation.
application -- The proper name of the package.
screen -- This creates a 'verbatim' environment that allows spacing to be controlled. Mainly used as it simulates a console. It should not be encapsulated by <para> unless unscreened text is present.

replaceable -- used with screen to encapsulate text that is not to be typed as seen or copy and pasted. The text should also be encapsulated in brackets '[]' for text browser users. It should also be used outside of the 'screen' where your instructions are for what is to replace it.

emphasis role="strong" -- used when an assumption is made in the instructions that may not always be true, i.e. your network connection is on <emphasis role=strong>eth0<emphasis>. Especially prior to giving script instructions using that assumption.
parameter -- used primarily in the command explanations section for items that are not commands.

note.para: There are several ways to use the userinput, command, option, replaceable, parameter, envar, constant, varname, etc., tags. Don't overdo it. In many cases, the tags will not change the output and will make editing the XML text more difficult. Generally, a single set of tags around a block of text is sufficient.
